result.execSummary:
The defendant Vance Lashawn Robertson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violation Of Injunction-Harassment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Violation Of Injunction-Harassment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent.  Huber privileges for work and childcare. Credit for 8 days  served.
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 9/29/22.

miscConds.notes:
Complete Batterers Intervention Program or a course in anger management.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
Follow orders in case 22CF1624 exactly as written.
DV assessment imposed.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Court advised defendant of appellant rights.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
Defendant to pay all nonwaivable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay. 
Court set restitution at zero.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vance Lashawn Robertson appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Vance Lashawn Robertson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing hearing held. Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 8 days served. Huber privileges for work and childcare.

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 8 days served. Huber privileges for work and childcare.

AS TO COUNT 6: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 8 days served. Huber privileges for work and childcare.

AS TO COUNT 7: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 8 days served. Huber privileges for work and childcare.

AS TO COUNT 8: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 8 days served. Huber privileges for work and childcare.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program or a course in anger management.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Follow orders in case 22CV1624 exactly as written.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- DV assessment imposed.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 9/29/22.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-27-22, filed

Defendant Vance Lashawn Robertson in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Vance Lashawn Robertson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a jury trial. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2, 4, and 5 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 6, 7, AND 8: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case is adjourned to Branch 29 for sentencing.

Defendant Vance Lashawn Robertson in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Vance Lashawn Robertson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Court passes case.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
